intro: Ouratea macurucoensis, commonly known as the Macuruco Ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, black seeds.
